{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "The Thriving Stellar Woman Initiative (TSWI) is a nonprofit organization committed to empowering underserved women and girls through entrepreneurship, digital skills and vocational training.

The organization was established in response to the socio-economic barriers that prevent many women and girls, especially those from low-income and marginalized communities, from becoming economically stable. Recognizing entrepreneurship as a powerful tool for economic independence, TSWI equips women and girls with practical skills, relevant information and support systems that enable them to build sustainable livelihoods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Onsite)

About the Role


	Thriving Stellar Woman Initiative (TSWI), a human capacity development organization focused on empowering underserved women and girls, is seeking a creative, detail-oriented, and results-driven Social Media Manager to join our team.
	As our Social Media Manager, your primary responsibility will be to grow and engage our online community across various social media platforms, our ngo and for profit platforms. Our brand guidelines, templates, and materials are already in place to support your work, making execution smoother and aligned with our voice and value.
	This role is ideal for someone who is creative, community-focused, and capable of balancing dynamic content strategies across both nonprofit and for-profit social impact spaces.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective content strategies across platforms
	Create engaging, on-brand content for various social media channels
	Online Community nurturing
	Design graphics and craft compelling captions and copy
	Plan, schedule, and publish posts consistently
	Conduct hashtag and keyword research to improve reach and visibility
	Manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns
	Monitor analytics and generate performance reports
	Capture, edit, and publish quality photo and video content
	Research and adapt to current social media trends
	Manage community engagement, including responding to comments and messages


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / NCE / B.Sc Degree
	Minimum of 1 year experience managing social media accounts
	Strong writing, editing, and visual storytelling skills
	Proficiency with social any media tools (e.g., Buffer, Hootsuite, Later)
	Working knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Suite)
	Basic video editing skills (e.g., CapCut, Adobe, or mobile apps)
	Ability to take clear, high-quality photos
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Passion for social media, creativity, and continuous learning.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Note:&nbsp;This role is female-preferred, in alignment with our commitment to promoting women&#39;s participation in digital and creative industries.",

Social Media Manager Job at thriving Stellar Woman Initiative (TSWI)




        
    

        
        The Thriving Stellar Woman Initiative (TSWI) is a nonprofit organization committed to empowering underserved women and girls through entrepreneurship, digital skills and vocational training.

The organization was established in response to the socio-economic barriers that prevent many women and girls, especially those from low-income and marginalized communities, from becoming economically stable. Recognizing entrepreneurship as a powerful tool for economic independence, TSWI equips women and girls with practical skills, relevant information and support systems that enable them to build sustainable livelihoods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

About the Role


	Thriving Stellar Woman Initiative (TSWI), a human capacity development organization focused on empowering underserved women and girls, is seeking a creative, detail-oriented, and results-driven Social Media Manager to join our team.
	As our Social Media Manager, your primary responsibility will be to grow and engage our online community across various social media platforms, our ngo and for profit platforms. Our brand guidelines, templates, and materials are already in place to support your work, making execution smoother and aligned with our voice and value.
	This role is ideal for someone who is creative, community-focused, and capable of balancing dynamic content strategies across both nonprofit and for-profit social impact spaces.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective content strategies across platforms
	Create engaging, on-brand content for various social media channels
	Online Community nurturing
	Design graphics and craft compelling captions and copy
	Plan, schedule, and publish posts consistently
	Conduct hashtag and keyword research to improve reach and visibility
	Manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns
	Monitor analytics and generate performance reports
	Capture, edit, and publish quality photo and video content
	Research and adapt to current social media trends
	Manage community engagement, including responding to comments and messages


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / NCE / B.Sc Degree
	Minimum of 1 year experience managing social media accounts
	Strong writing, editing, and visual storytelling skills
	Proficiency with social any media tools (e.g., Buffer, Hootsuite, Later)
	Working knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Suite)
	Basic video editing skills (e.g., CapCut, Adobe, or mobile apps)
	Ability to take clear, high-quality photos
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Passion for social media, creativity, and continuous learning.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Note: This role is female-preferred, in alignment with our commitment to promoting women's participation in digital and creative industries.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Desktop App Developer",
  "description": "Snaarp is your comprehensive all-in-one solution for safeguarding your enterprise with cutting-edge technology, seamless security, and unmatched reliability to protect against evolving threats.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Desktop App Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time/WFH

Summary


	We are looking to hire a highly skilled Cross-platform Desktop App Developer to join our team in designing, developing, and implementing robust cross-platform desktop security application with advanced data loss prevention and endpoint protection features.
	The ideal candidate will work closely with our System Engineer to ensure seamless integration of security features while maintaining optimal system performance.


Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain desktop applications using programming languages like C++, Java, or Python
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize software features
	Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code that adheres to industry standards
	Conduct thorough testing and debugging of desktop applications to ensure smooth and error-free functionality
	Develop the core functionality of the cross-platform desktop app.
	Provide ongoing maintenance and updates as needed.
	Document code and application design for future reference and team collaboration
	Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to desktop applications in a timely and efficient manner
	Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in desktop application development
	Provide technical support and guidance to other team members as needed
	Ensure security best practices in application development to safeguard sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree
	At least 5 years of proven experience in desktop application development
	Proficiency in C++, C#, or Java for cross-platform desktop development.
	Experience with desktop application frameworks such as Qt, .NET, or Electron
	Experience with version control systems such as Git or SVN
	Strong proven experience in system-level programming, security compliance, and OS-specific development (Windows, Linux &amp; macOS).
	Deep understanding of encryption techniques, access control mechanisms, and security best practices.
	Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills in high-performance computing environments.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV &amp; Portfolio to:&nbsp;hr@snaarp.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Desktop App Developer Job at Snaarp




        
    

        
        Snaarp is your comprehensive all-in-one solution for safeguarding your enterprise with cutting-edge technology, seamless security, and unmatched reliability to protect against evolving threats.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Desktop App Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time/WFH

Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking to hire a highly skilled Cross-platform Desktop App Developer to join our team in designing, developing, and implementing robust cross-platform desktop security application with advanced data loss prevention and endpoint protection features.
	The ideal candidate will work closely with our System Engineer to ensure seamless integration of security features while maintaining optimal system performance.


Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain desktop applications using programming languages like C++, Java, or Python
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize software features
	Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code that adheres to industry standards
	Conduct thorough testing and debugging of desktop applications to ensure smooth and error-free functionality
	Develop the core functionality of the cross-platform desktop app.
	Provide ongoing maintenance and updates as needed.
	Document code and application design for future reference and team collaboration
	Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to desktop applications in a timely and efficient manner
	Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in desktop application development
	Provide technical support and guidance to other team members as needed
	Ensure security best practices in application development to safeguard sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	At least 5 years of proven experience in desktop application development
	Proficiency in C++, C#, or Java for cross-platform desktop development.
	Experience with desktop application frameworks such as Qt, .NET, or Electron
	Experience with version control systems such as Git or SVN
	Strong proven experience in system-level programming, security compliance, and OS-specific development (Windows, Linux & macOS).
	Deep understanding of encryption techniques, access control mechanisms, and security best practices.
	Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills in high-performance computing environments.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV & Portfolio to: hr@snaarp.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Position: Store / Inventory Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Ojodu-Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD)

Job Description


	We are seeking a diligent and organized Store / Inventory Supervisor to join our team .
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in inventory management, attention to detail, and the physical stamina to support warehouse operations, including occasional heavy lifting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of stock levels, receipts, and dispatches
	Monitor inventory movement and ensure timely restocking
	Work closely with the procurement and logistics teams to track inventory needs
	Handle loading/unloading of items and support physical stock arrangements
	Conduct routine inventory checks and reconcile discrepancies
	Ensure proper storage, labeling, and organization of all items
	Ensure compliance with all inventory and safety procedures


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience as a Store/Inventory Officer
	Physically fit and able to handle some degree of heavy lifting
	Strong attention to detail and excellent record-keeping skills
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Excel
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Salary
N180,000 (Net)&nbsp;Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;laboriahr@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application for Store / Inventory Supervisor&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.

Store / Inventory Supervisor Job at Laboria Limited




        
    

        
        Laboria Limited, a biomedical solutions provider, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store / Inventory Supervisor

Job Location: Ojodu-Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD)

Job Description


	We are seeking a diligent and organized Store / Inventory Supervisor to join our team .
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in inventory management, attention to detail, and the physical stamina to support warehouse operations, including occasional heavy lifting.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate records of stock levels, receipts, and dispatches
	Monitor inventory movement and ensure timely restocking
	Work closely with the procurement and logistics teams to track inventory needs
	Handle loading/unloading of items and support physical stock arrangements
	Conduct routine inventory checks and reconcile discrepancies
	Ensure proper storage, labeling, and organization of all items
	Ensure compliance with all inventory and safety procedures


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience as a Store/Inventory Officer
	Physically fit and able to handle some degree of heavy lifting
	Strong attention to detail and excellent record-keeping skills
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Excel
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Salary
N180,000 (Net) Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: laboriahr@gmail.com using “Application for Store / Inventory Supervisor” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Construction General Manager",
  "description": "MP Infrastructure Limited is a leading infrastructure development and management company We focus on ICT, Renewable Energy, Power, Water, Technology, Oil Gas Process Facilities and Real Estate, offering the entire value chain of solutions from Audit, design and construction, to operation and maintenance across several industries including Telecoms, Energy, Oil Gas and Real Estate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Construction General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Organization: Engineering

Job Description


	A strategic and experienced Construction General Manager responsible for overseeing all phases of construction projects&mdash;from planning and budgeting to execution and completion.
	The role ensures timely, cost-effective delivery with high standards of quality and safety, requiring strong leadership and expertise in infrastructure projects such as buildings, roads, water systems, and power infrastructure


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement detailed project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation for the delivery of multiple infrastructure projects simultaneously.
	Manage and coordinate construction teams, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment and efficient project execution.
	Oversee project budgeting, forecasting, and financial controls to ensure cost efficiency.
	Ensure compliance with statutory legal laws, environmental regulations, safety standards, and client requirements.
	Monitor construction tracking and adjust schedules and resources as necessary.
	Foster strong relationships with government agencies, regulatory bodies, clients, and other stakeholders.
	Manage the procurement of materials, equipment, and services.
	Identify potential risks to projects and develop mitigation strategies.
	Ensure the implementation of quality control and health &amp; safety policies on site
	Provide strategic leadership and mentorship to project managers, engineers, architects, and site supervisors.
	Conduct regular meetings with the project team to review progress, address challenges, and ensure that goals are being met.
	Prepare and present regular reports on project status, risks, and milestones to executive leadership.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, standards, and best practices.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field (Master&#39;s degree or PMP is a plus).
	Minimum of 15&ndash;18 years of progressive experience in construction management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
	Proven experience managing large-scale infrastructure projects (building, roads, bridges, airports, energy, water systems, etc.).
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian construction codes, regulations, and procurement systems.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Ability to manage multiple projects under pressure and within tight deadlines.
	Proficient in construction project management software and tools (e.g., MS Project, Primavera, AutoCAD).
	Familiarity with international project management standards (e.g., FIDIC, ISO, World Bank/IFC guidelines) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of construction processes management.
	Strong financial acumen and experience with budget management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@mpiafrica.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Construction General Manager Job at MP Infrastructure Limited




        
    

        
        MP Infrastructure Limited is a leading infrastructure development and management company We focus on ICT, Renewable Energy, Power, Water, Technology, Oil Gas Process Facilities and Real Estate, offering the entire value chain of solutions from Audit, design and construction, to operation and maintenance across several industries including Telecoms, Energy, Oil Gas and Real Estate.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Construction General Manager

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Organization: Engineering

Job Description
     

            
    




	A strategic and experienced Construction General Manager responsible for overseeing all phases of construction projects—from planning and budgeting to execution and completion.
	The role ensures timely, cost-effective delivery with high standards of quality and safety, requiring strong leadership and expertise in infrastructure projects such as buildings, roads, water systems, and power infrastructure


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement detailed project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation for the delivery of multiple infrastructure projects simultaneously.
	Manage and coordinate construction teams, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment and efficient project execution.
	Oversee project budgeting, forecasting, and financial controls to ensure cost efficiency.
	Ensure compliance with statutory legal laws, environmental regulations, safety standards, and client requirements.
	Monitor construction tracking and adjust schedules and resources as necessary.
	Foster strong relationships with government agencies, regulatory bodies, clients, and other stakeholders.
	Manage the procurement of materials, equipment, and services.
	Identify potential risks to projects and develop mitigation strategies.
	Ensure the implementation of quality control and health & safety policies on site
	Provide strategic leadership and mentorship to project managers, engineers, architects, and site supervisors.
	Conduct regular meetings with the project team to review progress, address challenges, and ensure that goals are being met.
	Prepare and present regular reports on project status, risks, and milestones to executive leadership.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, standards, and best practices.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or related field (Master's degree or PMP is a plus).
	Minimum of 15–18 years of progressive experience in construction management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
	Proven experience managing large-scale infrastructure projects (building, roads, bridges, airports, energy, water systems, etc.).
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian construction codes, regulations, and procurement systems.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Ability to manage multiple projects under pressure and within tight deadlines.
	Proficient in construction project management software and tools (e.g., MS Project, Primavera, AutoCAD).
	Familiarity with international project management standards (e.g., FIDIC, ISO, World Bank/IFC guidelines) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of construction processes management.
	Strong financial acumen and experience with budget management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@mpiafrica.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Software Engineer - Industrial IoT",
  "description": "Canonical - We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely, and more cost-effectively than any other company. We develop Ubuntu, the world&rsquo;s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means &#39;humanity to others. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation. Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world&#39;s biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world&#39;s most productive developers. Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why it&#39;s the fastest-growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Software Engineer - Industrial IoT

Job Location:&nbsp;Remote

Job Summary


	This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open-source software, Linux, edge computing, and IoT.
	Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
	Your role will be to help us provide easy-to-deploy, secure, and customizable industrial edge solutions. You will work on designing and implementing applications that run on constrained IoT devices to powerful gateways. Embedded systems and Linux will be at the core of your everyday challenges.
	In our team, we value collaboration, peer reviews, good integration/unit testing and writing maintainable code. General knowledge and experience with Linux as a developer platform are required.&nbsp;


What you&rsquo;ll do


	Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
	Develop and maintain open source IoT application packages
	Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
	Work on Matter, the connectivity standard unifying smart homes
	Contribute to the development of IoT platforms
	Review code produced by upstream and/or other engineers at Canonical
	Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
	Experiment with Ubuntu Core and showcase industry-grade IoT solutions
	Participate in IoT standardisation working group discussions and planning (Connectivity Standards Alliance, Web of Things, etc)
	Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


Who you are


	You have a Bachelor&rsquo;s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.
	Proven track record of at least 3 years of professional software development using Go or C++.
	You have experience working with RESTful APIs, MQTT or other messaging protocols
	You are familiar with wireless communication protocols such as WiFi, BLE, Zigbee, Z-Wave, and Thread
	You have interest and experience with a few of the following:
	
		Containers (docker, kubernetes)
		Linux distributions
		Snap, Debian, or RPM packaging
		Shell scripting
		CI/CD (Github Actions, Gitlab CI, etc)
		IoT frameworks and protocols
		Real-time applications
	
	
	You value soft skills, communication and advocacy, and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-29",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-30",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Canonical Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Enugu, Lagos, Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "185022"
  },

      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Software Engineer - Industrial IoT Job at Canonical Nigeria




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Canonical - We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely, and more cost-effectively than any other company. We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation. Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers. Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why it's the fastest-growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer - Industrial IoT

Job Location: Remote

Job Summary


	This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open-source software, Linux, edge computing, and IoT.
	Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
	Your role will be to help us provide easy-to-deploy, secure, and customizable industrial edge solutions. You will work on designing and implementing applications that run on constrained IoT devices to powerful gateways. Embedded systems and Linux will be at the core of your everyday challenges.
	In our team, we value collaboration, peer reviews, good integration/unit testing and writing maintainable code. General knowledge and experience with Linux as a developer platform are required. 


What you’ll do


	Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
	Develop and maintain open source IoT application packages
	Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
	Work on Matter, the connectivity standard unifying smart homes
	Contribute to the development of IoT platforms
	Review code produced by upstream and/or other engineers at Canonical
	Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
	Experiment with Ubuntu Core and showcase industry-grade IoT solutions
	Participate in IoT standardisation working group discussions and planning (Connectivity Standards Alliance, Web of Things, etc)
	Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


Who you are


	You have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.
	Proven track record of at least 3 years of professional software development using Go or C++.
	You have experience working with RESTful APIs, MQTT or other messaging protocols
	You are familiar with wireless communication protocols such as WiFi, BLE, Zigbee, Z-Wave, and Thread
	You have interest and experience with a few of the following:
	
		Containers (docker, kubernetes)
		Linux distributions
		Snap, Debian, or RPM packaging
		Shell scripting
		CI/CD (Github Actions, Gitlab CI, etc)
		IoT frameworks and protocols
		Real-time applications
	
	
	You value soft skills, communication and advocacy, and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and
